member.name: M:Catel.Data.DataObjectBase.InitializeCustomProperties
member.summary:
Allows the initialization of custom properties. This is a virtual method that is called inside the constructor before the object is fully constructed.
This might be considered as bad or as a hack, but it's a good way to be able to inject custom properties before any actual logic is handled by derived classes.
member.remarks: Only use when you really know what you are doing.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.DataObjectBase.HideValidationResults
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the validation results should be hidden. This means that the should be filled, but the and should not expose any of the validation ressults.
This is very useful when the validation in the UI should be delayed to a specific point. However, the validation is still available for retrieval.
By default, this value is false.
member.value: true if the validation should be hidden; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Unlike the property, this property will not prevent validation. It will only prevent the error interfaces to not expose them.

member.name: T:Catel.DynamicEventListener
member.summary: Dynamic event listener which enables the subscription to events where the type of the handler is unknown. This class uses the ILGenerator to create the dynamic methods.
member.remarks:
Some parts in this class (with the instances and increments), but this is required to dynamically subscribe to an even that we do not know the handler of on forehand. Normally, you would do this via an anynomous delegate, but that doesn't work so the event delegate is created via ILGenerator at runtime.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8122085/calling-an-instance-method-when-event-occurs/8122242#8122242.

member.name: T:Catel.NotSupportedInSilverlightException
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not supported in Silverlight.
Unfortunately, Silverlight misses a lot of functionality. When a feature is not supported in Catel, this is because the .NET Framework (or actually Silverlight) does not allow the code to handle that specific feature.

member.summary: Get the reason why the feature is not supported.
member.value: The reason why the feature is missing.

member.name: T:Catel.NotSupportedInWindowsPhone7Exception
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not supported in Windows Phone 7.
Unfortunately, Windows Phone 7 misses a lot of functionality. When a feature is not supported in Catel, this is because the .NET Framework (or actually Windows Phone 7) does not allow the code to handle that specific feature.

member.name: T:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator
member.summary:
The service locator which is used to retrieve the right instances of interfaces.
The cool thing about this service locator is that it can use external containers (from example from Unity) to resolve types if the types are not registered in the container itself. To do this, use the following code:
var serviceLocator = ServiceLocator.Instance; serviceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(myUnityContainer);
The service locator will use the external containers in case the current container does not contain the type. If the external containers also don't contain the type, there is one last way to resolve the type using the event. The event passes that contains the type the service locator is looking for. By setting the or in the handler, the service locator will resolve the type.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(System.Object)
member.summary:
Registers an external container. This can be an external IoC container such as a Unity container.
Registering an external container in the service locator is very useful in case types are already registered in another container (in case of Prism, for example).
The will use the external container to resolve unregistered types.
Use the to check whether an external container is registered before registering it (otherwise this method will thrown an exception).

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainerHelper(Catel.IoC.IExternalContainerHelper)
member.summary:
Registers an implementation of the class.
This method can be used to add support for new external IoC containers.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.ExportInstancesToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all the current instances of the services to the external containers. This means that non-instantiated services will not be exported.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.ExportToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all services to external containers. If a service is not yet instantiated, the instance will be registered with the external container. Otherwise, the type will be registered.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.AutomaticallyKeepContainersSynchronized
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the service locator should keep the external containers in sync with the current .
This means that after every call to one of the following methods:
*
*
*
*
*
this class will automatically invoke the method.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the service locator should keep all containers synchronized; otherwise, false.

member.summary:

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a relative path string from a full path.
The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory The base path to truncate to and replace
Lower case string of the relative path. If path is a directory it's returned without a backslash at the end.
Examples of returned values: .\test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., ..
member.param: Full path to convert to relative path.
The base path (a.k.a. working directory). If this parameter is null or empty, the current working directory will be used.
member.returns: Relative path.

member.name: T:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator
member.summary:
The interface definition for our Message mediator. This allows loose-event coupling between components in an application by sending messages to registered elements.
This class implements the mediator pattern.

member.summary: Registers a specific recipient for a specific message.
member.returns: true if the handler is registered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be registered twice. If the same handler is already registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Unregister``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0},System.Object)
member.summary: Unregisters a specific recipient for a specific message with the specified tag.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.SendMessage``1(``0,System.Object)
member.summary: Broadcasts a message to all message targets for a given message tag and passes a parameter.
member.returns: true if any handlers were invoked; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.CleanUp
member.summary:
Cleans up the list of registered handlers. All handlers that are no longer alive are removed from the list.
This method is automatically invoked after each call to , but can also be invoked manually.

member.name: T:Catel.Messaging.MessageMediator
member.summary:
This class creates a simple Mediator which loosely connects different objects together.
The message handlers are organized using string-based message keys and are held in a WeakReference collection.
